newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian MP charged with defaming Suharto.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian MP charged with defaming Suharto.

text.p: An outspoken member of parliament from the minority Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI) was charged on Wednesday with defaming President Suharto, a prosecutor said.
Aberson Marle Sihaloho, a supporter of ousted PDI leader Megawati Sukarnoputri, was also charged with defaming the armed forces and parliament during the same speech in 1996.
"The defendant intentionally defamed President Suharto... during a forum held at the PDI headquarters," prosecutor Z.W. Were told the central Jakarta district court.
He said Sihaloho had accused the Suharto regime of suppressing the Indonesian people for 30 years.
Sihaloho can be jailed up to six years if found guilty. He has not been detained following assurances from his lawyers that he will not leave the country.
Sihaloho is alleged to have made the remarks at the PDI headquarters in Jakarta where Megawati's supporters used to gather before being ejected by police and soldiers on July 27.
Their ouster led to the worst riots in Jakarta in more than two decades in which at least five people were killed.
Megawati was ousted as PDI leader at a government-backed party congress in June and replaced by deputy parliament speaker Surjadi. She is challenging the move in court.
Earlier this month, the High Court upheld a lower court decision to send sacked legislator Sri Bintang Pamungkas to 34 months in jail for defaming Suharto.
